title: 82,000 guardians owed £20m in public body's second overcharging blunder
text:
The Office for the Public Guardian (OPG) in England and Wales is set to compensate 82,000 deputies and the vulnerable people they care for, after unlawfully overcharging them millions of pounds in court and admin fees.

Following the blunder, which went on for almost seven years, the OPG has now promised to repay the £20m it owes with interest.

Court-appointed deputies – who look after the financial affairs of people who lack mental capacity to do it themselves – were overcharged because the OPG was unable to predict the cost of administering court approvals and other fees, as the number of applications rose.
